Body: Most transformations fail because complexity overwhelms. We turned that complexity into an advantage—redefining planning, risks, and dashboards inside one integrated model.

Phase: 1: Cube floating free rotation - Mouse can click and spin the cube in all directions. When user starts scrolling, the cube shrinks gradually till reaches right starting point for animations.
Body: Let us show you a week in that universe — A Week in the Life of a Transformation Team <video link>. Farfetched? It’s here. We built the MVP: a Net.js web app with a Supabase database and a Gemini Assistant, built on a five-year scenario dataset inspired by real transformation events.
Notes: Add link on bolded text to the video. Assume the video is in th eassets and called aweekin.

Phase: 1: Cube floating free rotation - Mouse can click and spin the cube in all directions. When user starts scrolling, the cube shrinks gradually till reaches right starting point for animations.
Title Text: So How Did We Do It?
Body: Before answers, you need the right questions. This journey begins by uncovering the questions that matter most—the ones that unlock how complexity really works.
Notes: repeated animation means the the animation timing must spans the time it takes to comfortably transition the multiple text blocks. This is the only exceptional case. After this, the animation timing takes over.

Body: Many things, like a living system of systems—Strategy, Policies, Processes, Digital—shaped by external forces such as markets and global events. Real transformation means understanding how these components interact, not treating them in isolation.

Many things, like a living system of systems—Strategy, Policies, Processes, Digital—shaped by external forces such as markets and global events. Real transformation means understanding how these components interact, not treating them in isolation.
Notes: repeated text means the text skips transition for this phase and remains as is on the screen while the animation plays out

Body: Each component has its own inputs, outputs, and hidden ties to others. When those ties are mapped, patterns emerge—a structure that shows why small changes ripple across the whole system.

We already did—and the answer is yes. But do it with eyes open. Complexity runs deeper than expected, and guidance is scarce. That’s why we built a model that captures the whole picture and makes the path navigable.

Phase: 6: Popcorn Recolor, 1 by 1, slow then fast
Body: Two years of relentless work, unlocking barrier after barrier. Each layer exposed new dependencies, each cube revealed hidden ties. Piece by piece, the digital twin took shape—a living map of complexity. And just as it came together, AI leapt forward, suddenly powerful and accessible, turning years of struggle into a working reality.

Piece by piece, the digital twin took shape—a living map of complexity. And just as it came together, AI leapt forward, suddenly powerful and accessible, turning years of struggle into a working reality.

Body:
With the final piece in place—the very heart of the solution—the AI breathed life into the Digital Twin, reigniting hope for true transformation. The journey is not over for us or you, it continues through two distinct hubs:
TwinLab
Access our multi-media knowledge base and contribute to it in Wiki style. Help shape the future of transformations
TwinStudio
Take real steps towards your first use case and prototype V0 of your twin using our free tools. Start shaping your own transformation
